resources.string: The House GOP\'s two candidates for speaker detailed their plans during a closed-door meeting on Tuesday for avoiding a government shutdown - a key issue for members, and one that sank Kevin McCarthy\'s speakership. House Majority Leader Steve Scalise and Judiciary Chairman Jim Jordan made their pitches during the Tuesday meeting ahead of a conference vote for speaker on Wednesday, but GOP lawmakers made clear that the conference remains divided, and there\'s a heavy dose of skepticism among Republicans that they will quickly coalesce around either candidate to be the next speaker.
